item.title: System “absolutely rigged” says Our Revolution rally speaker
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
“You know what? The system is rigged. It is absolutely rigged. But we can unrig it if we are willing to do something.” It was a key point about the power of political activism made by Nina Turner, nationally-known political commentator who spoke at the Our Revolution Oklahoma rally Thursday in Oklahoma City. A year […]

The post System “absolutely rigged” says Our Revolution rally speaker appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Rally at Capitol slams latest tax bill in Congress
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Protesters gathered at the Oklahoma Capitol Saturday to push back against the so-called “Tax Cuts and Jobs Act,” passed at 1:50 in the morning Dec. 2 in the U.S. Senate. The bill is now with a conference committee to harmonize the Senate and House versions. Both houses will have to vote on the report before […]

The post Rally at Capitol slams latest tax bill in Congress appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Vigil at Capitol draws new activists – opposes “Trumpcare”
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Brandi and ­Jezy Gray would not say they were completely on the sidelines before Donald Trump’s election in November, 2016. But their approach to activism has changed since. “This administration has brought me out,” said Brandi. “Before the 2016 election, I wasn’t much involved in activism.” And then came election night when she and husband, […]

The post Vigil at Capitol draws new activists – opposes “Trumpcare” appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: “Rally Against Hate” at Capital draws larger crowd and counter protesters
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The second Anti-Trump protest rally in a week seemed to gain more traction for religious and social justice groups opposed to the harsh rhetoric of president-elect Donald Trump and his followers. The “Rally Against Hate” Sunday, Nov. 20, drew a bigger crowd than the Saturday before but, this time, also drew counter-protesters. Rally speeches once again […]

The post “Rally Against Hate” at Capital draws larger crowd and counter protesters appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Protest against Trump quickly turns to organizing
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
A protester who identified herself only as “October” held a sign that read “Pussy grabs back!” It was one of the more unusual protest signs against Donald Trump, the president-elect, referencing a crude comment Trump had made several years ago. She was one of around 150 protesters gathered in Bicentennial Park in downtown Oklahoma City […]

The post Protest against Trump quickly turns to organizing appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
